alert.note: Alert for Adams; Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:25AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Franklin, northwestern Webster, southwestern Adams and southern Kearney Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 625 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hildreth, or 18 miles east of Holdrege, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Upland around 640 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Campbell and Bladen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Hastings.
